description: Central octonomial coefficients: largest coefficient of (1+x+...+x^7)^n.
comments: Generally, largest coefficient of (1+x+...+x^k)^n is asymptotic to (k+1)^n * sqrt(6/(k*(k+2)*Pi*n)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 09 2013
links: T. D. Noe and Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500 (first 200 terms from T. D. Noe)
author: _David W. Wilson_
